verses.roman:
bhagavāṁs tad abhijñāya
giriśo yoga-māyayā
āviśat tad-guhākāśaṁ
vāyuś chidram iveśvaraḥ

synonyms: bhagavān—the great personality; tat—that; abhijñāya—understanding; giriśaḥ—Lord Giriśa; yoga-māyayā—by his mystic power; āviśat—entered; tat—of Mārkaṇḍeya; guhā-ākāśam—the hidden sky of the heart; vāyuḥ—the air; chidram—a hole; iva—as if; īśvaraḥ—the lord.
translation: Understanding the situation very well, the powerful Lord Śiva employed his mystic power to enter within the sky of Mārkaṇḍeya's heart, just as the wind passes through an opening.
